title: Voting Age
arg1: Show how 16-year-olds already have responsibilities (work, pay taxes, drive in some countries).
tip1: Argue they deserve representation too; use examples from countries where voting starts at 16.
arg2: Argue maturity and knowledge reasons why 18 is a better age.
tip2: Say teens are too influenced by peers/parents and lack life experience.

title: Extreme Sports
arg1: Use safety statistics or injury examples.
tip1: Stress government responsibility to protect citizens.
arg2: Emphasize freedom of choice and personal growth.
tip2: Compare extreme sports risks to everyday ones like driving.

title: AI in Education
arg1: Give 2 positive uses of AI (personalized learning, fast information).
tip1: Compare AI to calculators in math—once controversial, now normal.
tip2: Argue that real learning means thinking independently.

title: Social Media Age Limit
tip1: Use emotional examples like stress or online harassment.
arg2: Show 2 benefits (connection, digital skills, access to communities).
tip2: Suggest parental controls or rules instead of bans.

title: Homework
arg1: Give 2 reasons why practice at home improves performance.
tip1: Use analogy: training in sports improves skills just like homework does.
arg2: Argue from stress and well-being; mention family or hobby time.

title: Smartphones in Class
arg1: Present 2 strong cases where phones distract or harm focus.
tip1: Use examples of addiction or misuse in class.
arg2: Show how phones can be learning tools (apps, dictionaries, emergencies).
tip2: Suggest clear rules for responsible use.

title: AI & Jobs (Trending)
arg1: Give 2 sectors where AI disrupts jobs (transport, customer service).
arg2: Argue markets and companies innovate faster than governments.

title: Digital Privacy & Surveillance (Trending)
tip1: Use examples of data leaks or scandals.
tip2: Appeal to safety and public good.

title: Climate Policy — Urgency vs Growth (Trending)
arg1: Show evidence of climate risks and future costs of inaction.
arg2: Show how harsh policies can hurt jobs and stability.

title: Universal Basic Income — UBI (Trending)
arg1: Use examples or pilot projects; argue for poverty reduction and stability.
tip1: Show how it prepares for automation and inequality.
arg2: Argue it’s too expensive and discourages work.
tip2: Suggest other solutions like job programs or targeted aid.
